results.name: Number of times a multiple of four is encountered when iterating from 2^(n+1)-2 to (2^n)-2 with the map x -> x - (number of runs in binary representation of x).
comment: Also the number of even numbers in range [A255062(n) .. A255061(n+1)] of A255057 (equally, in A255067). See the sum-formulas.
link: A. Karttunen, Ratio a(n)/A255126(n) plotted, with the help of OEIS-server
example: For n=5 we start iterating with map m(n) = A236840(n) from the initial value (2^(5+1))-2 = 62. Thus we get m(62) = 60, m(60) = 58, m(58) = 54, m(54) = 50, m(50) = 46, m(46) = 42, m(42) = 36, m(36) = 32 and finally m(32) = 30, which is (2^5)-2. Of the nine numbers encountered, only 60, 36 and 32 are multiples of four, thus a(5) = 3.
program: (Scheme) (define (A255125 n) (if (zero? n) 1 (let loop ((i (- (expt 2 (+ 1 n)) 4)) (s 0)) (cond ((pow2? (+ 2 i)) s) (else (loop (- i (A005811 i)) (+ s (A133872 i))))))))
(define (add intfun lowlim uplim) (let sumloop ((i lowlim) (res 0)) (cond ((> i uplim) res) (else (sumloop (1+ i) (+ res (intfun i)))))))
